# UITableViewCell.SeparatorStyle

**Enumeration**

The style for cells to use as separators.

## Declaration

```swift
enum SeparatorStyle
```

## Overview

You use these constants to set the value of the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITableView/separatorStyle] property defined by [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITableView].

## Constants

- **UITableViewCell.SeparatorStyle.none**: The separator cell has no distinct style.
- **UITableViewCell.SeparatorStyle.singleLine**: The separator cell has a single line running across its width.
- **UITableViewCell.SeparatorStyle.singleLineEtched**: The separator cell has double lines running across its width, giving it an etched look.

## Initializers

- **init(rawValue:)**

## Customizing the separator appearance

- **separatorStyle**: The style for table cells to use as separators.
- **separatorColor**: The color of separator rows in the table view.
- **separatorEffect**: The effect to apply to table separators.
- **separatorInset**: The default inset of cell separators.
- **separatorInsetReference**: An indicator of how to interpret the separator inset value.
- **UITableView.SeparatorInsetReference**: Constants that indicate how to interpret the separator inset value of a table view.

## Conforms To

- BitwiseCopyable
- Equatable
- Hashable
- RawRepresentable
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
